clinical_study.brief_title: Change of Optic Nerve Sheath Diameter After Deflation of Pneumatic Tourniquet
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Deflation of Pneumatic Tourniquet on the Change of Optic Nerve Sheath Diameter in Patients Undergoing Knee Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the change of the optic nerve sheath diameter after deflation of pneumatic tourniquet.

detailed_description.textblock: Deflation of pneumatic tourniquet could induces many changes in various organ systems. It has been shown to affect intracranial pressure. Thus, the investigators evaluate the change of optic nerve sheath diameter using ultrasound after deflation of pneumatic tourniquet in patients undergoing knee surgery.

primary_outcome.measure: change of optic nerve sheath diameter
primary_outcome.time_frame: 5 minutes before deflation and at 5-minute intervals for 10 minutes after deflation
primary_outcome.description: difference in optic nerve sheath diameter measured using ultrasound before and after deflation of pneumatic tourniquet

study_pop.textblock: Patients undergoing knee surgery using pneumatic tourniquet

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- ASA physical status 1-4
- patients undergoing knee surgery using pneumatic tourniquet
Exclusion Criteria:
- patients who refuse to participate in this study
- patients with history of cerebrovascular disease
- patients who are judged ineligible by the medical staff to participate in the study for other reasons
